content: Which planet in our solar system is known for its distinct rings made of ice and rock particles?

That would be Saturn, the sixth planet from the Sun in our solar system. Saturn's rings are one of the most spectacular sights in the cosmos, consisting of countless ice and rock particles ranging in size from tiny grains to massive chunks several meters across. These rings orbit Saturn with a stunning symmetry and are a major reason why Saturn is often referred to as the "Jewel of the Solar System."
